content:
Project Class

Definition

Represents a project that can be built using MSBuild.

In this Article

[System.Obsolete("This class has been deprecated. Please use Microsoft.Build.Evaluation.Project from the Microsoft.Build assembly instead.")]
public class Project
Inheritance
System.Object
Project

Inherited Members

Equals(Object)
Equals(Object,Object)
GetHashCode()
GetType()
MemberwiseClone()
ReferenceEquals(Object,Object)
ToString()

Remarks

A Project represents an MSBuild project. It is a container for items, properties and targets. It can load project content from in-memory XML or from an XML file, and can save to an XML file, preserving most whitespace and all XML comments.

Every Project must be associated with an Engine to access shared information. During a build, the Engine object keeps track of which projects are currently building.

Constructors

Project()

Initializes a new instance of the Project class.

public Project ();

Project(Engine)

Initializes a new instance of the Project class using the supplied Engine.

public Project (Microsoft.Build.BuildEngine.Engine engine);
engine
Engine

The Engine instance to use for creating the project in memory.

Project(Engine,String)

Initializes a new instance of the Project class using the supplied Engine and crosoft.Build.BuildEngine.Project.ToolsVersion*.

public Project (Microsoft.Build.BuildEngine.Engine engine, string toolsVersion);
engine
Engine

The Engine instance to use for creating the project in memory.

toolsVersion
String

The crosoft.Build.BuildEngine.Project.ToolsVersion* to use for creating the project in memory.

Properties

BuildEnabled

Gets or sets a value indicating whether the project is enabled for building tasks and targets.

public bool BuildEnabled { get; set; }
Value
Boolean

true if the project is enabled for building tasks and targets; otherwise, false.

Remarks

By default, this property uses value of the BuildEnabled property of the project's ParentEngine.

DefaultTargets

Gets or sets the DefaultTargets attribute of the Project element in the MSBuild project.

public string DefaultTargets { get; set; }
Value
String

A semi-colon (;) delimited list of the targets specified in the DefaultTargets attribute.

DefaultToolsVersion

Sets or gets the ToolsVersion XML attribute found on the ProjectProject Element (MSBuild) element in the project file.

public string DefaultToolsVersion { get; set; }
Value
String

A string representing the Tools version.

Remarks

If the ToolsVersion attribute is not present on the assetId:///Project?qualifyHint=False&autoUpgrade=FalseProject Element (MSBuild) element, getting the value returns the default Tools version of the parent Microsoft.Build.BuildEngine.

The DefaultToolsVersion value can differ from the Tools version used during a build if its value is overridden during construction of the Project instance or it is set to a specific value with the ToolsVersion property. Setting the DefaultToolsVersion value cannot change the Tools version if it has been overridden, but you can change the Tools version using the ToolsVersion property.

For more information about Tools versions, see MSBuild Tool Set (ToolsVersion).

Encoding

Gets the encoding for the project file.

public System.Text.Encoding Encoding { get; }
Value
Encoding

An Encoding value of the project file.

EvaluatedItems

Gets a collection of the items evaluated during the build.

public Microsoft.Build.BuildEngine.BuildItemGroup EvaluatedItems { get; }
Value
BuildItemGroup

A BuildItemGroup containing the items evaluated during the build.

Remarks

The returned BuildItemGroup contains all the evaluated items in the project after wildcard and property expansion. The items in this property represent the actual items used during the build process. This property value is generated every time something in the project changes. Changes to existing items in this collection will be reflected the next time the project is saved, but adding or deleting items will not impact the project.

EvaluatedItemsIgnoringCondition

Gets a collection of all items in a project, even those not used in the build process because a Condition attribute evaluated to false.

public Microsoft.Build.BuildEngine.BuildItemGroup EvaluatedItemsIgnoringCondition { get; }
Value
BuildItemGroup

A BuildItemGroup containing all items in a project.

Remarks

The returned BuildItemGroup contains all items in the project after wildcard and property expansion, including those that were not used during the build process due to Condition attributes evaluating to false. This property value is only generated when certain changes occur, such as a new element being added to the project. Adding or deleting items from this property does not impact the project.

EvaluatedProperties

Gets a collection of the properties evaluated during the build.

public Microsoft.Build.BuildEngine.BuildPropertyGroup EvaluatedProperties { get; }
Value
BuildPropertyGroup

A BuildPropertyGroup containing the properties evaluated during the build.

Remarks

The returned BuildPropertyGroup contains all the evaluated properties in the project after performing condition evaluation and property expansion. The properties in this collection include global properties, environment variables, reserved properties, and imported properties. Changes to existing properties in this collection will be reflected the next time the project is saved, but adding or deleting properties will not impact the project.

Note

Cloning a BuildPropertyGroup can negatively impact performance. Only use a copy of this property when it is strictly necessary.

FullFileName

Gets or sets the fully qualified path and file name of the project file.

public string FullFileName { get; set; }
Value
String

The full path of the project file.

Remarks

This property is an empty string if the project does not have a file associated with it.

GlobalProperties

Gets or sets a collection of the global properties for the project.

public Microsoft.Build.BuildEngine.BuildPropertyGroup GlobalProperties { get; set; }
Value
BuildPropertyGroup

A BuildPropertyGroup containing the global properties for the project.

Remarks

Global properties are properties set with the /property switch on the command line, or properties set by the integrated development environment before invoking MSBuild. For more information, see MSBuild Command-Line Reference.

HasToolsVersionAttribute

Gets whether the Project file has the ToolsVersion XML attribute.

public bool HasToolsVersionAttribute { get; }
Value
Boolean

true if the project has the ToolsVersion attribute; otherwise, false.

Remarks

An example ToolsVersion attribute is Project ToolsVersion="3.5". This attribute enables projects to target .NET Framework versions, currently 2.0, 3.0, and 3.5. For more information about ToolsVersion, see Building for Specific Versions of the .NET Framework.

Imports

Gets the projects imported into this project.

public Microsoft.Build.BuildEngine.ImportCollection Imports { get; }
Value
ImportCollection

An ImportCollection of the projects imported into this project.

Remarks

Imported projects are specified by the element in the project.

InitialTargets

Gets or sets the InitialTargets attribute of the Project element in the MSBuild project.

public string InitialTargets { get; set; }
Value
String

A semi-colon (;) delimited list of the targets specified in the InitialTargets attribute.

IsDirty

Gets a value indicating whether the project has changed and needs to be saved to a file.

public bool IsDirty { get; }
Value
Boolean

true if the project has changed and needs to be saved; otherwise, false.

IsValidated

Gets a value indicating whether the project is to be validated against a schema.

public bool IsValidated { get; set; }
Value
Boolean

true if the project is to be validated against a schema; otherwise, false.

ItemGroups

Gets a collection of the item groups specified with the ItemGroup element in the project.

public Microsoft.Build.BuildEngine.BuildItemGroupCollection ItemGroups { get; }
Value
BuildItemGroupCollection

A BuildItemGroupCollection containing the item groups specifiied in the project.

Remarks

The BuildItemGroupCollection returned by this property contains the item groups in this project and all imported projects.

ParentEngine

Gets the Engine that builds the project.

public Microsoft.Build.BuildEngine.Engine ParentEngine { get; }
Value
Engine

The parent Engine object.

PropertyGroups

Gets a collection of the property groups specified with the PropertyGroup element in the project.

public Microsoft.Build.BuildEngine.BuildPropertyGroupCollection PropertyGroups { get; }
Value
BuildPropertyGroupCollection

A BuildPropertyGroupCollection containing the property groups specifiied in the project.

Remarks

The BuildPropertyGroupCollection returned by this property contains the property groups in this project and all imported projects.

SchemaFile

Gets or sets the XML schema file to use when validating the project.

public string SchemaFile { get; set; }
Value
String

The XML schema file to use when validating the project.

Targets

Gets the targets in the project.

public Microsoft.Build.BuildEngine.TargetCollection Targets { get; }
Value
TargetCollection

A TargetCollection of the targets in the project.

Remarks

Targets are specified by the element in the project.

TimeOfLastDirty

Gets a DateTime object indicating the time the project was last changed in a way that required it to be saved to a file.

public DateTime TimeOfLastDirty { get; }
Value
DateTime

A DateTime object indicating the time the project was last changed in a way that required it to be saved to a file.

ToolsVersion

Sets or gets the current version of the Toolset being used by the project.

public string ToolsVersion { get; }
Value
String

A string representing the version number of the Toolset.

Remarks

If the Toolset version is overridden, that value becomes the effective Toolset version. If there is a ToolsVersion attribute on the Project element, then that is the effective Toolset version. Otherwise, the Toolset version is the same as the default Toolset version of the parent engine. When set, ToolsVersion overrides the current Toolset version of the project with the provided value.

For more information about Toolsets, see Standard and Custom Toolset Configurations.

Note

To get or set the ToolsVersion attribute on the Project element, use the DefaultToolsVersion property.

UsingTasks

Gets a collection of the UsingTask elements in the project.

public Microsoft.Build.BuildEngine.UsingTaskCollection UsingTasks { get; }
Value
UsingTaskCollection

A UsingTaskCollection of the UsingTask elements in the project.

Xml

Gets the XML representing the project.

public string Xml { get; }
Value
String

The full XML representing the project.

Methods

AddNewImport(String,String)

Adds an Import element to the end of the project.

public void AddNewImport (string projectFile, string condition);
projectFile
String

The name of the project file to import. Corresponds to the Project attribute of the Import element.

condition
String

The condition to evaluate before importing the project. Corresponds to the Condition attribute of the Import element.

AddNewItem(String,String)

Adds the specified Item element to the project.

public Microsoft.Build.BuildEngine.BuildItem AddNewItem (string itemName, string itemInclude);
itemName
String

The name of the item collection to add the item to. Corresponds to the user-defined name of the Item element.

itemInclude
String

The value of the Include attribute of the item.

Returns
BuildItem

A BuildItem containing the created item.

Remarks

This method attempts to add the item to the project near the other items in the item collection.

AddNewItem(String,String,Boolean)

Adds the specified Item element to the project.

public Microsoft.Build.BuildEngine.BuildItem AddNewItem (string itemName, string itemInclude, bool treatItemIncludeAsLiteral);
itemName
String

The name of the item collection to add the item to. Corresponds to the user-defined name of the Item element.

itemInclude
String

The value of the Include attribute of the item.

treatItemIncludeAsLiteral
Boolean

true to treat the itemInclude parameter as a literal value; otherwise, false.

Returns
BuildItem

A BuildItem containing the created item.

Remarks

This method attempts to add the item to the project near the other items in the item collection.

AddNewItemGroup()

Adds a new ItemGroup element to the project.

public Microsoft.Build.BuildEngine.BuildItemGroup AddNewItemGroup ();
Returns
BuildItemGroup

A BuildItemGroup containing the created item group.

AddNewPropertyGroup(Boolean)

Adds a new PropertyGroup element to the project.

public Microsoft.Build.BuildEngine.BuildPropertyGroup AddNewPropertyGroup (bool insertAtEndOfProject);
insertAtEndOfProject
Boolean

true to insert the PropertyGroup at the end of the project; otherwise, false.

Returns
BuildPropertyGroup

A BuildPropertyGroup containing the created property group.

AddNewUsingTaskFromAssemblyFile(String,String)

Adds a new UsingTask element with the specified assembly file.

public void AddNewUsingTaskFromAssemblyFile (string taskName, string assemblyFile);
taskName
String

The name of the task to reference from the assembly. Corresponds to the TaskName attribute of the UsingTask element.

assemblyFile
String

The file path to the assembly. Corresponds to the AssemblyFile attribute of the UsingTask element.

AddNewUsingTaskFromAssemblyName(String,String)

Adds a new UsingTask element with the specified assembly name.

public void AddNewUsingTaskFromAssemblyName (string taskName, string assemblyName);
taskName
String

The name of the task to reference from the assembly. Corresponds to the TaskName attribute of the UsingTask element.

assemblyName
String

The name of the assembly to load. Corresponds to the AssemblyName attribute of the UsingTask element.

Build()

Builds the default targets of the project.

public bool Build ();
Returns
Boolean

true if the build was successful; otherwise, false.

Build(String)

Builds the specified target in the project.

public bool Build (string targetName);
targetName
String

The target to build.

Returns
Boolean

true if the build was successful; otherwise, false.

Build(String[])

Builds the specified list of targets in the project.

public bool Build (string[] targetNames);
targetNames
String[]

The list of targets to build. This parameter can be a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic) to build the default targets.

Returns
Boolean

true if the build was successful; otherwise, false.

Build(String[],IDictionary)

Builds the specified list of targets in the project, and returns the outputs of the targets.

public bool Build (string[] targetNames, System.Collections.IDictionary targetOutputs);
targetNames
String[]

The list of targets to build. This parameter can be a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic) to build the default targets.

targetOutputs
IDictionary

The outputs of the built targets. This parameter can be a null reference (Nothing) if outputs are not needed.

Returns
Boolean

true if the build was successful; otherwise, false.

Build(String[],IDictionary,BuildSettings)

Builds the specified list of targets in the project using the specified settings, and returns the outputs of the targets.

public bool Build (string[] targetNames, System.Collections.IDictionary targetOutputs, Microsoft.Build.BuildEngine.BuildSettings buildFlags);
targetNames
String[]

The list of targets to build. This parameter can be a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic) to build the default targets.

targetOutputs
IDictionary

The outputs of the built targets. This parameter can be a null reference (Nothing) if outputs are not needed.

buildFlags
BuildSettings

The BuildSettings to apply to the build.

Returns
Boolean

true if the build was successful; otherwise, false.

GetConditionedPropertyValues(String)

Returns a list of possible values for the specified property.

public string[] GetConditionedPropertyValues (string propertyName);
propertyName
String

The property to use when generating the list of possible values.

Returns
String[]

The list of possible values for the property.

Remarks

This method generates the list of possible values by inspecting all of the attributes in the project that involve the property.

GetEvaluatedItemsByName(String)

Returns all evaluated items belonging to the specified item collection.

public Microsoft.Build.BuildEngine.BuildItemGroup GetEvaluatedItemsByName (string itemName);
itemName
String

The name of the item collection.

Returns
BuildItemGroup

A BuildItemGroup containing all of the evaluated items belonging to the specified item collection.

GetEvaluatedItemsByNameIgnoringCondition(String)

Returns all items belonging to the specified item collection.

public Microsoft.Build.BuildEngine.BuildItemGroup GetEvaluatedItemsByNameIgnoringCondition (string itemName);
itemName
String

The name of the specified item collection.

Returns
BuildItemGroup

A BuildItemGroup containing all items belonging to the specified item collection, even those not used in the build process because a Condition attribute evaluated to false.

GetEvaluatedProperty(String)

Returns the value of the specified property.

public string GetEvaluatedProperty (string propertyName);
propertyName
String

The name of the property.

Returns
String

The value of the specified property.

Remarks

If you need to retrieve a large number of property values, use the EvaluatedProperties property.

GetProjectExtensions(String)

Returns a string value of the XML from the specified element in the ProjectExtensions element.

public string GetProjectExtensions (string id);
id
String

The name of the element in the ProjectExtensions element to return.

Returns
String

The string value of the specified element in the ProjectExtensions element of the project.

Load(TextReader)

Loads the contents of the specified TextReader into the Project object.

public void Load (System.IO.TextReader textReader);
textReader
TextReader

The TextReader to load.

Exceptions
InvalidProjectFileException

The file used by the textReaderTextReader is not a valid project file.

Load(String)

Loads the contents of the specified project file into the Project object.

public void Load (string projectFileName);
projectFileName
String

The project file to load.

Exceptions
InvalidProjectFileException

The file specified by projectFileName is not a valid project file.

Load(TextReader,ProjectLoadSettings)

Reads the contents of this project from a string containing the XML contents.

public void Load (System.IO.TextReader textReader, Microsoft.Build.BuildEngine.ProjectLoadSettings projectLoadSettings);
textReader
TextReader

A TextReader object containing the project contents.

projectLoadSettings
ProjectLoadSettings

A ProjectLoadSettings value that specifies the settings for the project being loaded.

Load(String,ProjectLoadSettings)

Reads the contents of this project from a project XML file on disk.

public void Load (string projectFileName, Microsoft.Build.BuildEngine.ProjectLoadSettings projectLoadSettings);
projectFileName
String

A string representing the name of the file to load.

projectLoadSettings
ProjectLoadSettings

A ProjectLoadSettings value that specifies the settings for the project being loaded.

LoadXml(String)

Loads the contents of the specified string into the Project object.

public void LoadXml (string projectXml);
projectXml
String

The string of XML to load.

Exceptions
InvalidProjectFileException

The XML contained in projectXML is not a valid project file.

LoadXml(String,ProjectLoadSettings)

Reads the contents of this project from a string containing the XML contents.

public void LoadXml (string projectXml, Microsoft.Build.BuildEngine.ProjectLoadSettings projectLoadSettings);
projectXml
String

A string containing the project contents.

projectLoadSettings
ProjectLoadSettings

A ProjectLoadSettings value that specifies the settings for the project being loaded.

MarkProjectAsDirty()

Sets the crosoft.Build.BuildEngine.Project.IsDirty* property of the project to true.

public void MarkProjectAsDirty ();

RemoveAllItemGroups()

Removes all item groups from the project, but does not modify imported projects.

public void RemoveAllItemGroups ();

RemoveAllPropertyGroups()

Removes all property groups from the project, but does not modify imported projects.

public void RemoveAllPropertyGroups ();

RemoveImportedPropertyGroup(BuildPropertyGroup)

Removes the specified property group from the main project file.

public void RemoveImportedPropertyGroup (Microsoft.Build.BuildEngine.BuildPropertyGroup propertyGroupToRemove);
propertyGroupToRemove
BuildPropertyGroup

A BuildPropertyGroup object representing the group to remove.

RemoveItem(BuildItem)

Removes the specified item from the project.

public void RemoveItem (Microsoft.Build.BuildEngine.BuildItem itemToRemove);
itemToRemove
BuildItem

The item to remove from the project.

RemoveItemGroup(BuildItemGroup)

Removes the specified item group from the project.

public void RemoveItemGroup (Microsoft.Build.BuildEngine.BuildItemGroup itemGroupToRemove);
itemGroupToRemove
BuildItemGroup

The item group to remove from the project.

RemoveItemGroupsWithMatchingCondition(String)

Removes all item groups with the specified condition from the project, but does not modify imported projects.

public void RemoveItemGroupsWithMatchingCondition (string matchCondition);
matchCondition
String

The condition to match when removing item groups.

RemoveItemsByName(String)

Removes all items in the specified item collection from the project, but does not modify imported projects.

public void RemoveItemsByName (string itemName);
itemName
String

The item collection to remove.

RemovePropertyGroup(BuildPropertyGroup)

Removes the specified property group from the project.

public void RemovePropertyGroup (Microsoft.Build.BuildEngine.BuildPropertyGroup propertyGroupToRemove);
propertyGroupToRemove
BuildPropertyGroup

The property group to remove from the project.

RemovePropertyGroupsWithMatchingCondition(String)

Removes all property groups with the specified condition from the project, but does not modify imported projects.

public void RemovePropertyGroupsWithMatchingCondition (string matchCondition);
matchCondition
String

The condition to match when removing property groups.

RemovePropertyGroupsWithMatchingCondition(String,Boolean)

Removes all 's from the main project file that have a specific "Condition."

public void RemovePropertyGroupsWithMatchingCondition (string matchCondition, bool includeImportedPropertyGroups);
matchCondition
String

A string representing the condition of the PropertyGroups that you want removed.

includeImportedPropertyGroups
Boolean

A boolean value indicating whether to include imported property groups in the search.

Remarks

This will not remove any property groups from imported project files.

ResetBuildStatus()

Resets the status every target in the project so that the next build will build all targets again.

public void ResetBuildStatus ();

Save(TextWriter)

Saves the project in the specified TextWriter object.

public void Save (System.IO.TextWriter textWriter);
textWriter
TextWriter

The TextWriter object in which to save the project.

Save(String)

Saves the project to the specified file.

public void Save (string projectFileName);
projectFileName
String

The name of the file in which to save the project.

Save(String,Encoding)

Saves the project in the specified file with the specified encoding.

public void Save (string projectFileName, System.Text.Encoding encoding);
projectFileName
String

The name of the file in which to save the project.

encoding
Encoding

The Encoding value with which to save the file.

SetImportedProperty(String,String,String,Project)

Sets the value of a property in the specified imported project.

public void SetImportedProperty (string propertyName, string propertyValue, string condition, Microsoft.Build.BuildEngine.Project importProject);
propertyName
String

The name of the property to change.

propertyValue
String

The value to assign the property.

condition
String

The condition to use on the property. Corresponds to the Condition attribute of the Property element.

importProject
Project

The Project that contains the specified property.

SetImportedProperty(String,String,String,Project,PropertyPosition)

Sets the value of a property in the specified imported project.

public void SetImportedProperty (string propertyName, string propertyValue, string condition, Microsoft.Build.BuildEngine.Project importedProject, Microsoft.Build.BuildEngine.PropertyPosition position);
propertyName
String

The name of the property to change.

propertyValue
String

The value to assign the property.

condition
String

The condition to use on the property. Corresponds to the Condition attribute of the Property element.

importedProject
Project

The Project that contains the specified property.

position
PropertyPosition

A PropertyPosition value indicating the location to insert the property.

SetImportedProperty(String,String,String,Project,PropertyPosition,Boolean)

Sets the value of a property in the specified imported project.

public void SetImportedProperty (string propertyName, string propertyValue, string condition, Microsoft.Build.BuildEngine.Project importedProject, Microsoft.Build.BuildEngine.PropertyPosition position, bool treatPropertyValueAsLiteral);
propertyName
String

The name of the property to change.

propertyValue
String

The value to assign the property.

condition
String

The condition to use on the property. Corresponds to the Condition attribute of the Property element.

importedProject
Project

The Project that contains the specified property.

position
PropertyPosition

A PropertyPosition value indicating the location to insert the property.

treatPropertyValueAsLiteral
Boolean

true to treat the propertyValue parameter as a literal value; otherwise, false.

Remarks

Sets the value of a property and optionally escapes it so that it will be treated as a literal value despite any special characters it may contain.

SetProjectExtensions(String,String)

Sets the ProjectExtensions element of the project with the specified element name and content.

public void SetProjectExtensions (string id, string content);
id
String

The name of the XML element to create as a child of the ProjectExtensions element.

content
String

The text value of the created XML element.

SetProperty(String,String)

Sets the value of the specified property.

public void SetProperty (string propertyName, string propertyValue);
propertyName
String

The name of the property to change.

propertyValue
String

The value to assign the property.

SetProperty(String,String,String)

Sets the value of the specified property.

public void SetProperty (string propertyName, string propertyValue, string condition);
propertyName
String

The name of the property to change.

propertyValue
String

The value to assign the property.

condition
String

The condition to use on the property. Corresponds to the Condition attribute of the Property element.

SetProperty(String,String,String,PropertyPosition)

Sets the value of the specified property.

public void SetProperty (string propertyName, string propertyValue, string condition, Microsoft.Build.BuildEngine.PropertyPosition position);
propertyName
String

The name of the property to change.

propertyValue
String

The value to assign the property.

condition
String

The condition to use on the property. Corresponds to the Condition attribute of the Property element.

position
PropertyPosition

A PropertyPosition value indicating the location to insert the property.

Remarks

SetProperty is called from the integrated development environment (IDE) to set a particular property at the project level. This method searches the existing property groups for a property with this name. If one is found, it changes its value. Otherwise, it either adds a new property to that property group, or adds a new property group to the project. SetProperty uses the condition parameter to determine the name of the property group place it in.

SetProperty(String,String,String,PropertyPosition,Boolean)

Sets the value of the specified property.

public void SetProperty (string propertyName, string propertyValue, string condition, Microsoft.Build.BuildEngine.PropertyPosition position, bool treatPropertyValueAsLiteral);
propertyName
String

The name of the property to change.

propertyValue
String

The value to assign the property.

condition
String

The condition to use on the property. Corresponds to the Condition attribute of the Property element.

position
PropertyPosition

A PropertyPosition value indicating the location to insert the property.

treatPropertyValueAsLiteral
Boolean

true to treat the propertyValue parameter as a literal value; otherwise, false.
